{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms include headache, blurred vision, and diplopia (double vision) when looking to the left with the right eye. These symptoms suggest a problem with the nerves that control eye movements. Internuclear ophthalmoplegia is a condition that affects the eye movements, specifically the ability to move the eyes horizontally. It is caused by damage to the fibers that connect the two nuclei of the cranial nerves that control eye movements. The other options like Tb meningitis, cranial neuritis, and demyelination can cause a wide range of neurological symptoms, but they are not specifically associated with the symptoms described in the question.", "answer_choice": "B. Internuclear ophthalmoplegia"}
